metadata.title: Configure OPDS Catalog for iOS Readest Access

story.iWant: browse and download books to my iPhone using the Readest app via OPDS catalog access
story.soThat: I can read on iOS without managing files manually

Install and Configure Readest on iOS

doc.title: Technical Specification: Device Sync & Remote Access
doc.snippet: Goal: Enable iOS users to browse and download books from the library using the Readest app without manual file management. Includes API specification (GET /opds, GET /opds/categories/{category}, GET /opds/books/{book_id}), authentication requirements, and performance targets (<2 seconds response time).

doc.title: BookHelper - Epic Breakdown
doc.section: Epic 2: Device Sync & Remote Access - Story 2.2
doc.snippet: As a reader, I want to browse and download books to my iPhone using Readest, so that I can read on iOS without managing files manually. Acceptance criteria covers endpoint availability, catalog access, metadata display, download functionality, and authentication.

doc.title: BookHelper System Architecture
doc.section: 3.2 Sync & Backup Layer - File Sync (for Ebook Library Distribution)
doc.snippet: Server → iOS: There is no background file sync to iOS. The Readest app on iOS uses the OPDS protocol to download ebooks on-demand from the Calibre-Web-Automated server. OPDS is a standardized protocol for ebook discovery and download.

doc.title: BookHelper Product Requirements Document
doc.section: User Journey 1: Adding a New Ebook and Reading Across Devices - Step 3: Sync to Devices
doc.snippet: iOS: User opens Readest app, browses OPDS catalog, book appears instantly. System supports on-demand ebook download via OPDS protocol without background file sync.

artifact.reason: CWA service configuration - defines image version (dev), port mapping (8083), environment variables for authentication, volume mounts for library and plugins. OPDS endpoint runs on port 8083 at root URL.

constraint.description: OPDS 1.2 Standard - OPDS catalog must conform to OPDS 1.2 specification for compatibility with Readest and other iOS ebook readers
CWA Built-in Support - OPDS is embedded in Calibre-Web-Automated v3.1.0+; no additional services or code required. Configuration is entirely admin-panel driven.
constraint.source: docker-compose.yml - CWA image includes OPDS module

constraint.description: Local Network Only (MVP) - OPDS endpoint accessible on http://raspberrypi.local:8083/opds only on home WiFi. Remote access via Tailscale VPN will be implemented in Story 2.3.
Response Time Target: OPDS catalog must respond in <2 seconds (measured from GET /opds)
Basic Auth Optional - If CWA admin panel login is enabled, OPDS endpoint requires basic auth credentials. Readest supports basic auth in catalog settings.
No New Schema Required - OPDS reads directly from existing Calibre metadata.db; no new database tables or transformations needed

interface.name: Readest iOS App - Add Catalog

steps.step: Launch Readest app on iOS device
Navigate to Settings → Catalogs → Add New
If CWA requires login: Enter basic auth credentials
Browse library in Readest - books should appear instantly

interface.note: Readest must support OPDS 1.2 protocol (confirmed in v1.5+)

tests.standards: Testing for Story 2.2 is primarily manual and integration-focused because OPDS is a built-in CWA feature (no custom code to unit test). Focus on endpoint availability, metadata display quality, and cross-device functionality. Key test areas: (1) Endpoint responds with valid OPDS 1.2 XML and appropriate status codes, (2) Catalog displays all books with correct metadata (title, author, cover art), (3) Download functionality works for multiple formats (EPUB primary), (4) Readest can parse and render downloaded ebooks, (5) Persistence after CWA container restart, (6) Performance meets <2 second target.

locations.location: Manual testing checklist documented in Story file: docs/stories/2-2-configure-opds-catalog-for-ios-readest-access.md#Tasks-/-Subtasks
CWA healthcheck: docker-compose.yml includes health check (curl -f http://localhost:8083/)
CWA logs: docker logs calibre-web-automated (monitor for startup messages and OPDS endpoint initialization)

ideas.test_idea: HTTP Endpoint Validation: curl -i http://raspberrypi.local:8083/opds - verify 200 status and valid OPDS 1.2 XML structure
Response Time Test: measure time from request to response completion, should be <2 seconds under normal load
Readest Catalog Add: Install Readest v1.5+, add catalog URL, verify Readest recognizes and lists books
Metadata Validation: Compare book titles, authors, and cover art in Readest against CWA library source
Cover Art Display: Verify cover images load and display correctly (not broken/missing)
Download Test: Download 2-3 ebooks in different formats (EPUB, MOBI) from Readest, verify file integrity
Reading Test: Open downloaded EPUB in Readest, navigate pages, verify text and images render correctly
Reader Features: Test highlighting, bookmarking, font sizing in Readest with downloaded book
Container Restart: docker restart calibre-web-automated, verify OPDS endpoint remains accessible after startup
Catalog Persistence: Verify books still appear in Readest after CWA restart (no metadata loss)
Auth Configuration: If ADMIN_PASSWORD is set, verify OPDS requires basic auth and Readest can authenticate
Auth Failure: Attempt OPDS access with wrong credentials, verify 401 response
Network Stability: Test from different WiFi locations in home, verify consistent access
Remote Access (Story 2.3): Note current limitation - OPDS only accessible on local WiFi. Tailscale will enable remote access via VPN IP (100.x.x.x)

implementation_guidance.overview: Story 2.2 requires minimal development effort because OPDS is a built-in CWA feature. Primary activities are: (1) verify CWA version supports OPDS 1.2, (2) enable OPDS in admin panel if not enabled by default, (3) test end-to-end with Readest on iOS, (4) validate all acceptance criteria. No code changes expected; work is configuration and validation focused.

dev_focus.description: Confirm CWA v3.1.0+ is running and OPDS module is available. Check docker-compose.yml shows correct CWA image and port (8083).
dev_focus.docker_check: docker ps - should show calibre-web-automated container running
dev_focus.endpoint_check: curl -i http://raspberrypi.local:8083/opds - should return 200 and OPDS XML

dev_focus.description: Install Readest, add CWA OPDS catalog, verify books appear with correct metadata. Test download and reading functionality.

manual_steps.step: Install Readest v1.5+ from App Store
Verify >20 books appear in Readest catalog view
Open book in Readest and verify readability

dev_focus.description: Verify book metadata displays correctly: titles, authors, cover art. Check for missing or corrupted data.

validation.check: Compare 5 random books from Readest catalog against CWA library web UI
Verify cover art URLs resolve and images display
Spot-check author names and descriptions match source

dev_focus.description: Test CWA restart behavior - OPDS endpoint should remain available after container restart with no data loss.

test_procedure.step: Record OPDS response before restart: curl http://raspberrypi.local:8083/opds | wc -l (line count)
Wait for container to start (check logs: docker logs calibre-web-automated)
Verify response line count matches (no data loss)
In Readest: Refresh catalog, verify books still appear

issue.title: OPDS Endpoint Disabled by Default?
issue.mitigation: Check CWA admin panel at http://raspberrypi.local:8083/admin. If OPDS is disabled, enable it and restart CWA. Verify with curl.

issue.title: Readest Authentication Failure
issue.mitigation: If CWA has ADMIN_PASSWORD set (from docker-compose.yml), add basic auth to Readest catalog settings. Use ADMIN_USERNAME:ADMIN_PASSWORD in Readest.

issue.title: Cover Art Missing or Slow Loading
issue.mitigation: Monitor CWA logs for errors. If persistent, may indicate Calibre library metadata incomplete (missing cover files). Verify covers exist in /calibre-library/

success_criteria.criterion: ✓ OPDS endpoint responds at http://raspberrypi.local:8083/opds with HTTP 200 and valid OPDS 1.2 XML
✓ Readest can add catalog and display >20 books with correct metadata
✓ Book download from OPDS works; EPUB opens in Readest without errors
✓ All 8 acceptance criteria verified and documented
✓ OPDS endpoint persists after CWA container restart
